means: 保证，誓言
[法]抵押权
公约
（表示友谊的）干杯
使发誓，保证
典当，抵押
许诺
用…担保
以誓言约束
向…祝酒
作出庄重有约束力的誓言
祝愿，祝酒
[人名] 普莱奇

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"保证"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: ensure, insure, assure, guarantee, pledge, promise
means: ensure ： 侧重使人相信某个行为或力量产生的结果。
insure常与ensure换用，但前者多指经济方面的保证、保险。
assure ： 侧重指消除某人思想上的怀疑或担心，从而有达到目的的保证感，但不如ensure普通。
guarantee ： 指对事物的品质或人的行为及履行义务、义务等承担责任的保证。
pledge ： 正式用词，指通过郑重许诺、协议或立誓等保证承担某一义务或遵守某一原则。
promise ： 侧重表自己的主观意向，设法用语言使人感到稳当可靠。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"誓言"之意。
means: oath ： 指对上帝或神发出的庄严、正式的誓言以示自己话语的真实性。现多用于法庭上。
pledge ： 普通用词，指保证去做或不做某事的郑重许诺。
vow ： 指庄严的许诺或誓约。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"保证，担保"之意。
means: pledge ： 普通用词，指严肃地承诺、信守原则，常以个人名誉作为承诺的保证。
guarantee ： 一般指以口头的、协定或合同的形式作为保证、担保，强调口头承诺，含违背许诺，则予以补偿之意。
assurance ： 指用语言保证以消除人们思想上的怀疑与担心。

word_mean: 誓言：一种表明态度的庄严宣告

sentence.Network_en: His tax-cutting pledge brought a delirious crowd to their feet.
sentence.Network_cn: 他减税的承诺让亢奋的人群欢呼雀跃起来。

sentence.Network_en: In the treaty both sides pledge to respect human rights.
sentence.Network_cn: 双方在条约中都承诺将尊重人权。

sentence.Network_en: I pledge that by next year we will have the problem solved.
sentence.Network_cn: 我保证来年之前我们将解决这个问题。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a person acting as surety for another): from Old French plege, from medieval Latin plebium, perhaps related to the Germanic base of plight

encyclopedia.content: PLEDGE作词：流鬼。作曲：the GazettE（异端者 乐队）编曲：弦一彻歌：the GazettE the GazettE是一支5人组合的视觉系乐队，由主唱松本贵之（ruki）、吉他手高岛宏阳（丽）和城山优（葵）、贝斯手玲木亮（reita）和鼓手田边丰（戒）组成。乐队成立、出道于2002年3月，当年结成后的4月马上发售了第一张单曲，之后转入了日本著名的演艺事务所PS COMPANY，从此以后他们就开始了在日本乐坛大展手脚的征途。日文歌词 伤付けた后でしか

entry.def: When someone makes a pledge, they make a serious promise that they will do something.

example.ex: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
example.tran: 会议以承诺加快这一地区六国间的合作而结束。

example.ex: ...a £1.1m pledge of support from the Spanish ministry of culture.
example.tran: 来自西班牙文化部110万英镑的资助许诺

entry.tran: 保证，许诺，发誓（做）；保证给予
entry.def: When someone pledges to do something, they promise in a serious way to do it. When they pledge something, they promise to give it.

example.ex: Mr Dudley has pledged to give any award to charity...
example.tran: 达德利先生已承诺将任何所获的损害赔偿额都捐给慈善机构。

example.ex: Philip pledges support and offers to help in any way that he can...
example.tran: 菲利普保证给予支持，并主动提出尽其所能提供帮助。

entry.def: If you pledge a sum of money to an organization or activity, you promise to pay that amount of money to it at a particular time or over a particular period.

example.ex: The French President is pledging $150 million in French aid next year...
example.tran: 法国总统许诺为法国明年的援助经费拨款1.5亿美元。

example.ex: The government has now pledged £170m over the next six years for improving primary care.
example.tran: 为了改善初级卫生保健工作，政府已承诺在未来6年内拨款1.7亿英镑。

entry.tran: 使保证，使许诺，使发誓（遵循或支持）
entry.def: If you pledge yourself to something, you commit yourself to following a particular course of action or to supporting a particular person, group, or idea.

example.ex: The President pledged himself to increase taxes for the rich but not the middle classes...
example.tran: 总统保证增加对富人而非中产阶级的税收。

example.ex: Tony Cottee has pledged himself to Everton Football Club for another three years...
example.tran: 托尼·科蒂已答应同埃弗顿足球俱乐部再续约3年。

entry.def: If you pledge something such as a valuable possession or a sum of money, you leave it with someone as a guarantee that you will repay money that you have borrowed.

example.ex: He asked her to pledge the house as security for a loan.
example.tran: 他要她拿房子来抵押贷款。

means.word_mean: 1. a deposit of personal property as security for a debt;
2. someone accepted for membership but not yet fully admitted to the group
3. a drink in honor of or to the health of a person or event
4. a binding commitment to do or give or refrain from something;

sentences.sentence: "signed a pledge never to reveal the secret"
"I pledge that will honor my wife"

means.word_mean: 2. pay (an amount of money) as a contribution to a charity or service, especially at regular intervals;

sentences.sentence: "I pledged $10 a month to my favorite radio station"

means.word_mean: 5. bind or secure by a pledge;

auth_sentence.res_content: European countries pledge to help retrain the Malian army.

auth_sentence.content: Your solution needs to be like the doctors pledge.
auth_sentence.res_content: Your solution needs to be like the doctors pledge.

Sentence.sentence: But taking a cue from health experts, a group of 19 restaurant companies are pledging to offer more-healthful menu options for children at a time when concern is growing over the role of fast food in childhood obesity(肥胖症).

sentences.en: The government should fulfil its pledge.
Take this ring as a pledge of our friendship.
sentences.cn: 收下这枚戒指当作我们友谊的信物。

sentences.en: She left her gold bracelet as a pledge.
sentences.cn: 她留下她的金手镯作抵押品。

means.word_mean: 保证, 许诺; 发誓

sentences.en: The old man is willing to pledge for him.
sentences.cn: 那位老人愿意为他担保。

sentences.en: They have pledged that they will always remain faithful to each other.
sentences.cn: 他们发誓他们将永远忠诚于对方。

sentences.en: They have pledged their support for our case.
sentences.cn: 他们已发誓支持我们的诉讼。
